channel.title: CVE Feed for Pluggabl LLC -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Pluggabl LLC -- all products

item.title: CVE-2021-34646|2024-08-04T00:19:47.618Z -- pluggabl%20llc -- booster%20for%20woocommcerce
item.description: Versions up to, and including, 5.4.3, of the Booster for WooCommerce WordPress plugin are vulnerable to authentication bypass via the process_email_verification function due to a random token generation weakness in the reset_and_mail_activation_link function found in the ~/includes/class-wcj-emails-verification.php file. This allows attackers to impersonate users and trigger an email address verification for arbitrary accounts, including administrative accounts, and automatically be logged in as that user, including any site administrators. This requires the Email Verification module to be active in the plugin and the Login User After Successful Verification setting to be enabled, which it is by default.

item.title: CVE-2023-48747|2024-08-02T21:37:54.940Z -- pluggabl%20llc -- booster%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: Improper Authentication vulnerability in Pluggabl LLC Booster for WooCommerce allows Accessing Functionality Not Properly Constrained by ACLs.This issue affects Booster for WooCommerce: from n/a through 7.1.2.

item.title: CVE-2024-29760|2024-08-02T01:10:55.438Z -- pluggabl%20llc -- booster%20for%20woocommerce
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Pluggabl LLC Booster for WooCommerce allows Reflected XSS.This issue affects Booster for WooCommerce: from n/a through 7.1.7.
